title: How to Make Chocolate Chip Peanut Butter Cookies

steps.headline: Combine flour, baking soda and salt in a medium bowl.
steps.description: Mix it well with a whisk and put to the side.

steps.headline: Blend brown and white sugar with an electric mixer.
steps.description: Add the butter, the vanilla extract and eggs to the mixture and mix until fluffy.

steps.headline: Add the flour mixture, chocolate chips and the peanut butter to the mixture, and blend with an electric mixture.
Place spoonfuls of the dough on a greased cookie sheet.
steps.description: Put them about one and a half inches apart. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until light brown. When finished, put them to a cooler surface to cool off.

text: Preheat the oven to 325 °F (163 °C).  Combine flour, baking soda and salt in a medium bowl. Mix it well with a whisk and put to the side. Blend brown and white sugar with an electric mixer. Add the butter, the vanilla extract and eggs to the mixture and mix until fluffy. Add the flour mixture, chocolate chips and the peanut butter to the mixture, and blend with an electric mixture.  Place spoonfuls of the dough on a greased cookie sheet. Put them about one and a half inches apart. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until light brown. When finished, put them to a cooler surface to cool off. Finished.
